meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to feel upset or annoyed.
meanings.sent1: When my computer freezes, it frustrates me.
meanings.sent2: The constant noise from the construction site frustrates the neighbors.
meanings.sent3: Trying to untangle a knot in a shoelace can be quite frustrating.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending traffic jam on the highway frustrates drivers to no end.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle's missing piece frustrated her efforts to complete it.

meanings.definition: Prevent (a plan or action) from progressing successfully.
meanings.sent1: A sudden rainstorm can frustrate a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent2: Technical difficulties can frustrate the live broadcast of the event.
meanings.sent3: The magician's disappearing act was meant to frustrate the audience.
meanings.sent4: The locked door frustrated their escape plan.
meanings.sent5: The lack of funding frustrated the development of the new project.

meanings.definition: Feel upset or annoyed due to inability to change or achieve something.
meanings.sent1: Being stuck in traffic always frustrates me.
meanings.sent2: She frustrates easily when things don't go according to plan.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics can sometimes frustrate its owner.
meanings.sent4: His constant lateness frustrates his friends.
meanings.sent5: The inability to find a solution to the problem frustrated the team.
